item.title: 8 Most Accurate Simulation Games
item.description:
Summary

  • Some simulation games strive for extreme accuracy, like Football Manager 2024's realistic player stats.
  • SnowRunner challenges players with offroad terrain decisions, impacting the driving experience.
  • Kerbal Space Program offers a comical presentation but a highly detailed physics simulation.

Some simulation games focus on fun and simplistic gameplay. Others only partially simulate a scenario. Yet there are some games that take a simulation to its extremes, intending that the game is as accurate a representation of real life as possible.

War and combat simulations often aim to be realistic, either in the gameplay, or, for example. Other simulation games simulate scientific scenarios, such as physics. And yet others aim to put the player in control of an accurately simulated vehicle or aircraft. What all of the best simulation games have in common, is a deep and detailed recreation of a real-world situation.

8 Football Manager 2024

Realistic Player Stats

Football Manager 2024 is the latest iteration of the hugely successful Football Manager franchise. The game has always been notable because of its detailed representation of all aspects of managing a football team. The aim is for the team manager to keep their job across multiple seasons, by achieving wins.

Players have to scout new players, train current players, select players to make up their team, and negotiate contracts among other features. The depth of the simulation and the huge database of players and teams the game features, make it one of the most accurate simulations around.

7 SnowRunner

Offroad Driving Simulator

SnowRunner is an offroad driving simulation game with a significant twist. The game presents a number of different landscapes that the player must learn how to traverse safely. This includes snowbound regions, dirt roads, parts of the map that have been flooded, and other types of hazardous terrain.

The player has to choose the right vehicle to make the journey, and plan the right route. Some challenges involve moving sensitive cargo, and other challenges. The well-thought-out offroad driving mechanics and the severe impact that the terrain has on the player, make this a great simulation game.

6 Euro Truck Simulator 2

Trucking Across Europe

The second driving simulation game on this list is Euro Truck Simulator 2 . This game has something of a cult following, allowing players to get a feel of how it is to be a long-distance truck driver on Europe's highways.

The road network is detailed, with fully simulated traffic patterns that are impacted by road conditions such as the weather. The player has to manage their vehicle, maintain it, and meet delivery schedules on time. The game does a great job of simulating logistics challenges from the cab of a truck.

5 Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020

A Benchmark Release

  • Platforms: PC (Microsoft Windows), Xbox Series X|S
  • Released: 2020 (PC) 2021 (Xbox)
  • Developer: Asobo Studio
  • Genre: Flight simulator

The 2020 release of Microsoft Flight Simulator saw a milestone update to this veritable franchise. On launch, it was the most accurate and detailed representation of aviation ever. Based on map data from the real world, the player is free to fly anywhere in the world.

The game can be tackled by casual players but is also comprehensive enough to satisfy experienced pilots as well. The game has a profusion of detailed aircraft simulations, from light aircraft to huge commercial jets. The flight mechanics are entirely accurate as well.

4 Kerbal Space Program

Incredible Physics Simulation

As simulation games go, Kerbal Space Program is a bit of an oddity. Where most simulation games opt for detailed, accurate graphics, this game does things differently. Kernels are cute, cartoonlike entities, who are more than a little ridiculous at times.

However, behind this comical representation lays an incredibly detailed physics simulation. The player has to help the Kerbels get into space, and this involves designing rockets that can break out of the gravity well, which is a huge challenge, one that humankind has spent tens of billions of dollars achieving in the real world. With realistic orbital mechanics, getting the Kerbels back home again is a challenge all of its own, as well.

3 Silent Hunter 5: Battle of the Atlantic

Detailed Submarine Simulation

  • Platforms: PC (Microsoft Windows)
  • Released: 2010
  • Developer: Ubisoft Bucharest
  • Genre: Simulator

Silent Hunter 5 puts the player in control of a submarine during World War 2. This is not so much a sub-piloting simulator as it is a simulation of captaining a submarine. The player must manage their crew, ensuring good morale, for example.

However, in combat scenarios, the player is responsible for navigation and plotting a course, taking steps to avoid being detected by the enemy, and taking aggressive action against mission targets using torpedoes. Overall, this is a great, holistically correct naval simulation game.

2 Factorio

Logistics And Manufacturing Simulation

The only 2D simulation game on this list is Factorio . However, despite the limited graphics, it takes a spot near the top of this list for its depth and complexity. In this game, players are responsible for setting up complex production chains to produce goods.

As part of this simulation, the player must overcome engineering challenges, and ensure that production chains are efficient, and do not run out of needed resources. For players who enjoy intellectual and puzzle-solving challenges, the simulated industrial processes in Factorio will keep them busy for many hours.

1 Arma 3

Intense Battlefield Simulation

Arma 3 is a first-person, military battlefield simulation game that goes all out to be as real as it can be. This is a multiplayer, team-based game, with opposing teams competing to complete map objectives.

The large-scale battles involve players using authentically simulated weapons and vehicles, and require players to have an understanding of modern battlefield tactics. Arma 3 is such an accurate simulation, that it has actually been used for military training in the past. For players looking for the ultimate realistic battlefield experience, Arma 3 is the go-to game.

item.title: 7 Best FPS Games With Muskets, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Darkest of Days offers a unique historical FPS experience with muskets - save key individuals from history.
  • War of Rights immerses players in the American Civil War with muskets and realistic battles.
  • Holdfast: Nations At War provides solid combat mechanics, historical conflicts, and musket action.

Ever since it was first introduced to gamers more than three decades ago, the FPS genre has become one of the most popular out there. Some titles in this genre play better with a controller than a mouse and keyboard, giving players a chance to choose. A few more focus on fast-paced combat with formidable enemies, whereas others prefer to revisit historical periods.

Whatever the case, there’s always fun to be had. Some historical FPS games feature weapons like muskets, which are very powerful, although sometimes inaccurate and hard to reload. Many of the titles covered below allow players to either traverse the battlefield from a third-person perspective or zoom into their weapon’s sights through a first-person view. Here are some of the best FPS games with muskets.

7 Darkest of Days

An Interesting Adventure Through Time

  • Platform(s): Windows, Xbox 360, macOS, Classic Mac OS
  • Released: September 07, 2009
  • Developer(s): 8monkey Labs
  • Genre(s): FPS
  • Players must save key individuals from death
  • Various weapons are available, including muskets

While Darkest of Days isn't one of those FPS titles that will keep players busy for months, it still manages to deliver an entertaining experience for those who love history. Players will be in control of a soldier called Alexander Morris under General Custer's leadership during the Battle of Litle Big Horn.

Throughout the game, players will have to take part in different historical battles to rescue important individuals from dying. Darkest of Days features various weapons, including muskets, which makes it a solid addition to the list.

6 War Of Rights

An American Civil War Story

  • The game covers many aspects of the American Civil War
  • Muskets are part of the combat experience

Set during the Maryland campaign in 1862, War of Rights presents players with a multiplayer-only experience that features maps of the battles of Antietam, South Mountain, Shepherdstown and more. On top of the well-crafted locations this title offers, there’s also great allied AI chatter that gives the experience a more realistic feeling.

War of Rights is one of those games that can provide players who fall in love with it with hundreds of hours of unending fun. Given the game's period, there are muskets frequently involved in combat.

5 Battle Cry Of Freedom

An Authentic American Civil War Experience

  • Platform(s): Windows
  • Released: March 01, 2022
  • Developer(s): Flying Squirrel Entertainment
  • Genre(s): Shooter Video Game, Role-playing game, Indie game
  • Fast-paced battles
  • Realistic depiction of the American Civil War

It’s no secret that the American Civil War has sparked interest in movies, TV shows and games alike for decades. It was such an important period in history, that it has much to offer to both historians and history buffs alike. Battle Cry of Freedom touches on some of the most critical events of this armed conflict, allowing players to experience it in a very authentic way.

The game offers some unique control schemes, exciting battles, and the possibility to play in both a third and a first-person perspective.

4 Battle Grounds 3

A Great Title Covering The American War Of Independence

  • Platform(s): Windows
  • Released: June 30, 2019
  • Developer(s): The Battle Grounds Game Development Team
  • Genre(s): Shooter Video Game
  • Set in the American War of Independence
  • Fun combat experience

Leaving the American Civil War period behind and going further back in time, there’s Battle Grounds 3 , an outstanding title set during the American War of Independence. The game presents players with an authentic experience during this important historical period, pitting British and American forces against one another for the ultimate battle.

Battle Grounds 3 isn’t one of the most challenging games out there, but it does present players with hard, yet satisfying gunplay, an entertaining combat experience, and interesting locations that feel true to the events covered.

3 Holdfast: Nations At War

A Game That Covers Key Historical Armed Conflicts

  • Platform(s): Windows, GeForce Now
  • Released: September 21, 2017
  • Developer(s): Anvil Game Studios
  • Genre(s): Shooter Video Game, RPG
  • Fun multiplayer experience
  • Solid combat mechanics

Similar to some other games on the list, Holdfast: Nations At War offers players an online multiplayer experience that can be enjoyed from both a first and a third-person perspective, giving the game versatility.

Covering important historical periods from the Napoleonic era and World War 1, Holdfast: Nations At War should be played by those who consider themselves to be history buffs. With great battlefield combat mechanics, tons of musket action, and beautifully designed uniforms for the soldiers on the battlefield, Holdfast: Nations At War is definitely a game to keep an eye on.

2 Hunt: Showdown 1896

An Interesting Premise With Late-19th-Century Elements

  • Interesting concept based on hunting monsters in American rural areas
  • A large variety of weapons to choose from

As opposed to other titles on this list, Hunt: Showdown 1896 takes a more fictional approach rather than focusing on accurate depictions of historical conflicts. Players will be tasked with hunting the savage monsters roaming the Louisiana swamps and the mountains in Colorado. Although the game’s concept is interesting, it can also feel a bit basic sometimes.

Now, just because Hunt: Showdown won’t make it into the hall of fame of the best story-driven FPS games out there, it doesn’t mean that it’s not fun to play. With a wide variety of weapons to choose from, including muskets, and different challenges presented to players, this title offers a great experience.

1 Mount & Blade: Warband - Napoleonic Wars

An Expansion Pack That's Definitely Worth Playing

  • Multiple unique units
  • The game covers important historical battles

While Napoleonic Wars is not a standalone game, but rather a multiplayer DLC expansion for Mount & Blade: Warband , it still deserves a spot on this list, as it presents players with a great experience covering the final years of the French Empire’s dominance and expansion.

This title supports up to 250 players with more than 220 unique units to fight immersive historical battles, including the invasion of Russia and several others. All in all, Mount & Blade: Warband - Napoleonic Wars is a great game that allows players to use muskets and see what the bloody battles of the early 18th century looked like.

item.title: Indiana Jones and the Great Circle: Where to Find the Guard House Key
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Guard House Location
  • Guard House Key Location

Indiana Jones and the Great Circle brings all the cinematic joy of the film franchise to consoles and PC. Players can expect all the white-knuckle action present in the movies, along with globetrotting in pursuit of ancient artifacts. Indy has to set off for the Vatican after a mysterious figure has stolen a statue from his college's museum collection. You'll have to get through Castel Sant'Angelo first. The castel and the Vatican have been taken over by fascist black shirts.

This beginning area acts as a tutorial for how weapons and puzzles will behave in the game. You can sneak through the castel or face your foes head on. Either way, you may stumble onto the locked Guard House door while making your way through the castel. Follow this guide to learn where the Guard House is located and where you can find the Guard House Key in Indiana Jones and the Great Circle.

Guard House Location

The Guard House can be found in the southeastern corner of Castel Sant'Angelo. Look for it at the black and white arrow on the map above. You can find the Castel Sant'Angelo Map on the right before you enter the small chapel.

Once you exit the chapel, Indy needs to ascend the center of the castel to reach the Vatican. There are two stationary blackshirts and one patrolling up and down the corridor. Take them out and proceed. The Guard House is on the left side of the path. There is a blackshirt resting against the building while another will walk a small path in front of him.

Walk to the intricate door, and you'll see that Indy needs the Guard House Key to open it.

Guard House Key Location

Thankfully, the key is nearby. Handle the blackshirt that's resting against the wall by sneaking into the small area behind him. Take him out when the other guard enters the door on the left ahead. You can then sneak into the small office ahead and stealthily take him down when he's staring at the wall. Look where the blackshirt was staring, and you'll find the key hanging on the wall.

Return to the door with the Guard House Key and turn it to gain access to this area. You can go upstairs and use the guard house as a shortcut by unlocking another door to exit. The Guard House has a single blackshirt along with some revolver bullets you can loot off a desk.

item.title: Clash Royale: Best It’s Raining Gifts Decks
item.description:
Christmas has officially arrived in Clash Royale , and the game is bringing the holiday vibes with its new event, It’s Raining Gifts. It kicked off on Dec 16 and is a bit different from usual Clash Royale events. You’ll still build your usual eight-card deck, but here’s the twist: Hog Rider spawns automatically every few seconds.

We all know how tricky it can be to handle the Hog Rider, and in this event, it gets even tougher. The Hog Rider also drops powerful spells like Rage and Clone, which can make things even more chaotic. Keeping that in mind, in this guide, we will share some of the best decks to help you crush the It’s Raining Gifts event in Clash Royale .

Best It’s Raining Gifts Decks in Clash Royale

Players can use any card in the It’s Raining Gifts event, even the evolved variants like the Evo Musketeer and the Evo Mega Knight. Here are some decks you can try:

Deck One:

Average Elixir: 3.5

This is one of the strongest decks for It's Raining Gifts. Archers, Goblin Gang, and Bats are great for handling swarms like Skeleton Army, Goblins, and Guards, as well as flying troops like Dragons and Minions.

As we mentioned above, Hog Rider spawns automatically in the event, so these cards and cannon can also help players deal with it, as well as big units like P.E.K.K.A or Royal Giant.

Clash Royale Cards

Elixir Cost

Archers

Three Elixir

Royal Recruits

Seven Elixir

Valkyrie

Four Elixir

Fisherman

Three Elixir

Goblin Gang

Three Elixir

Bats

Two Elixir

Arrows

Three Elixir

Cannon

Three Elixir

Deck Two:

Average Elixir: 3.6.

This deck is all about power. P.E.K.K.A is your main tank and can easily handle Hog Rider, Mega Knight, and other big threats. Goblinstein is there to go straight for your opponent’s towers, and Bomber, Firecracker, and Minions will clear out swarms.

Clash Royale Cards

Elixir Cost

Minions

Three Elixir

Firecracker

Three Elixir

P.E.K.K.A

Seven Elixir

Goblinstein

Five Elixir

Fisherman

Three Elixir

Bomber

Two Elixir

Guards

Three Elixir

Arrows

Three Elixir

Deck Three:

Average Elixir: 4.0

This deck is pretty similar to the second one with cards like Arrows, Archers, Goblinstein, and P.E.K.K.A. It also has Cannon to help deal with Hog Rider, and Firecracker and Archers to back up your P.E.K.K.A and Ram Rider.

Clash Royale Cards

Elixir Cost

Cannon

Three Elixir

Goblinstein

Five Elixir

Firecracker

Three Elixir

P.E.K.K.A

Seven Elixir

Ram Rider

Five Elixir

Archers

Three Elixir

Guards

Three Elixir

Arrows

Three Elixir

item.title: Stardew Valley: How To Befriend Gus
item.description:
The proprietor of Pelican Town's Stardrop Saloon, Gus is one of the most lovable characters in all of Stardew Valley . Good-natured and jovial, Gus is a friend to all in town, including the player character.

Of course, players still have to put in the effort before Gus becomes a close confidante. As with all the villagers in town, Gus has his own likes and dislikes, his own goals and worries. By offering some thoughtful gifts or helping him gather ingredients for new recipes, farmers can gain his favor — and reap all the benefits.

Updated December 18, 2024, by Demaris Oxman : Stardew Valley 's 1.6 update is available for players on all platforms, and fans of farming sims can't wait to see what it's brought to the table. Among many exciting additions like new festivals and the mastery system, several smaller tweaks have been made as well, including some changes to villagers' gift preferences. One of these villagers is Gus, the jovial owner of the Stardrop Saloon. This guide has been updated with more tips on befriending him, as well as up-to-date information as of version 1.6.

Gift Guide

Players can show Gus their generosity by stopping by to offer a gift and have a quick chat. Find him in his saloon whenever it's open. Additionally, bear in mind that gifts given on his birthday, Summer 8, will count for 8x the usual friendship effect.

Loved Gifts

As the best options for Gus, each of these gifts will raise friendship with him by 80 points. When trying to win him over, keep these items on hand.

  • Diamond
  • Orange
  • Cooked dishes: Escargot , Tropical Curry , Fish Taco
  • All universal loves

Liked Gifts

When Loved gifts are hard to come by (and in the early game, Gus's often are), these are good options as well. Each increases friendship by 45 points.

  • Daffodil
  • Truffle
  • All universal likes , except for Coleslaw (e.g. cooked dishes, artisan goods, vegetables, flowers)

Disliked & Hated Gifts

Any of the following items will decrease friendship when given to Gus. Though Disliked gifts aren't as bad as Hated, it's best to avoid any drop in friendship points, so don't give these to Gus.

  • Salmonberry
  • Wild Horseradish
  • Coleslaw
  • Holly
  • Quartz
  • All universal dislikes (e.g. fish, building materials, geodes, seeds)
  • All universal hates (e.g. trash, fossils, monster loot)

Interactions & Effects On Friendship

Quests

  • Fish Stew – On the 26th of Winter, Gus will send the player a letter asking them to catch him an albacore for a fish stew. Farmers who do so will receive 400g, and friendship will increase by one heart .
  • Wanted: Lobster – On Fall 6th of Year 2, Gus requests a lobster to whip up a bisque. As before, this will increase friendship by one heart , as well as rewarding players with 500g.
  • Exotic Spirits – Gus is hoping to bring some sunshine to the cold Stardew Valley winter. On the 19th of Winter in Year 2, he'll ask for a coconut to make tropical drinks at the Saloon. Players reap the rewards of one friendship heart and 600g.
  • "Help Wanted" Objectives – As with any other villager, Gus may post on the bulletin outside Pierre's, requesting a random item. Players will receive 150 friendship points for completing these requests.

Movie Theater

Players can take Gus to the movie theater at any time after it becomes available. Depending on which movie they see and the concessions they pick, they can increase or decrease their friendship with Gus. Gus' preferences for the movie theater include:

Movies

Love

  • The Miracle At Coldstar Ranch
  • Wumbus

Like

  • It Howls In The Rain
  • Journey of the Prairie King: The Motion Picture
  • Natural Wonders: Exploring Our Vibrant World
  • The Brave Little Sapling
  • The Zuzu City Express

Dislike

Mysterium

Concessions

Love

  • Cappuccino Mousse Cake
  • Panzanella Salad
  • Stardrop Sorbet
  • Truffle Popcorn

Like

  • Chocolate Popcorn
  • Fries
  • Ice Cream Sandwich
  • Nachos
  • Personal Pizza
  • Popcorn
  • Salmon Burger
  • Salted Peanuts
  • Star Cookie

Dislike

All others

Heart Event

At four hearts , players can enter Gus' saloon during open hours. (Note that Pam must also be at two hearts with the player.) Gus will admit that the saloon is struggling financially; however, he is reluctant to ask Pam to pay her tab, as the two are good friends.

The player then talks to Pam to convince her to pay up. Choosing the harsher dialogue will make Gus upset; however, the gentler option will get Pam to pay her debt, and slightly raise friendship with Gus.

Friendship Perks

Friends of Gus' can look forward to receiving delicious dishes in the mail . These are especially helpful early in the game, when player can run out of energy quickly. The higher the player's friendship with Gus, the more likely he'll be to help keep them fed.

At certain friendship levels, Gus will even share his expert recipes with the player:

  • Salmon Dinner – Sent at three hearts. This dish restores 125 Energy and 56 Health.
  • Cranberry Sauce – Sent at seven hearts. Not only does it provide the same restorative properties as above, but it also gives +1 Mining.

Once players reach five hearts with Gus, he'll come to the player's farm and tell them he has come to think of them as a friend. He'll then present them with a mini jukebox , allowing farmers to play their favorite tunes from the game's soundtrack as they do their work on the farm.
